intro: Acinodendron dispar, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of violet, pink, and white. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Acinodendron dispar thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
